medical_history.chief_complaint: A 33-year-old man with AIDS presented with a 3-day history of fever, abdominal pain, jaundice, and decreasing urine output.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 3 days prior to admission. There has been noted progression to multiorgan dysfunction, worsening anemia, thrombocytopenia, and renal failure.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of multiple episodes of oral candidiasis treated with fluconazole. He was hospitalized three weeks before presentation for methicillin-susceptible Staphylococcus aureus bacteremia and tricuspid valve endocarditis, secondary to intravenous drug use.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is an intravenous drug user.
